sect1.title: STORED - Workflow Service
sect1.para: [attribute := ] expression : STORED STORED ( storedname [, FEW FEW ][, FORMAT([FIELDWIDTH(widthvalue)][,SEQUENCE(sequencevalue)])] ) STORED workflow service ;

row.entry: Optional. The name of the Attribute.
A string constant containing the name of the stored attribute result.

Optional. When the expression is a dataset or recordset, FEW specifies that the dataset is stored completely within the workunit. If not specified, then the dataset is stored as a THOR file and the workunit contains only the name of the file. The FEW option is required when using STORED in a SOAP-enabled MACRO and the expected input is a dataset (such as tns:xmlDataset).
Optional. FORMAT specifies options for formatting the field on a Web form in WsECL.
Optional. FIELDWIDTH specifies the width of the input box on a Web form in WsECL.
An integer expression defining the width (number of characters) of the input box
Optional. SEQUENCE specifies field ordering on a Web form in WsECL.
An integer expression defining the sequential location of the input box.

sect1.para: The STORED service stores the result of the expression with the work unit that uses the attribute so that it remains available for use throughout the work unit. If the attribute name is omitted, then the stored value can only be accessed afterwards from outside of the ECL execution. If an attribute name is provided then the value of that attribute will be pulled from storage, if it has not yet been set it will be computed, stored and then usedÂ from storage. This service implicitly causes the attribute to be evaluated at a global scope instead of the enclosing scope.
